Module App_utils
Package App_utils.printer

Class Printer

java.lang.Object
App_utils.printer.Printer
public class Printer extends Object
Provides basic printing and reading user's input functionalities for terminal.

    • print

    • print

      public static void print(String message, AnsiColors color)
      Prints a message to terminal, with a given set of colors.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print.
      color - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.

    • print

      public static void print(String message, AnsiColors foreground, AnsiColors background)
      Prints a message to terminal with a given set of colors, Use the two colors to set foreground and background of the message.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print.
      foreground - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.
      background - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.

      public static void println(String message, AnsiColors foreground, AnsiColors background)
      Prints a message to terminal with a given set of colors, Use the two colors to set foreground and background of the message.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print.
      foreground - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.
      background - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.

    • input

      public static String input(String message)
      A combination of a print and input actions. First print a given message then waits for user's input.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      Returns:
      Input wrote by the user.

    • input

      public static String input(String message, AnsiColors color)
      A combination of a print and input actions. First print a give message then waits for user's input.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      Returns:
      Input wrote by the user.

    • inputIf

      public static String inputIf(String message, Predicate<String> condition)
      Works the same as input but ask for input until it meet a given condition.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      condition - Function to evaluate if the input valus is correct.
      Returns:
      Input wrote by the user.

    • inputIf

      public static String inputIf(String message, String wrongInputMessage, Predicate<String> condition)
      Works the same as input but ask for input until it meet a given condition.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      wrongInputMessage - text to print if the input don't fulfill the condition.
      condition - Function to evaluate if the input valus is correct.
      Returns:
      Input wrote by the user.

    • input

      public static String input(String message, AnsiColors foreground, AnsiColors background)
      A combination of a print and input actions. First print a give message then waits for user's input.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      foreground - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.
      background - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.
      Returns:
      Input wrote by the user.

    • inputInt

      public static int inputInt(String message)
      Works the same as "inputMethod" but returning an int.
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      Returns:
      int given by the user.

    • printConfirmation

      public static void printConfirmation(String message, String footer)
      Prints a message, and stop the program flow until, user press "ENTER".
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      footer - text to print after reading input.

    • printConfirmation

      public static void printConfirmation(String message, String footer, AnsiColors color)
      Prints a message, and stop the program flow until, user press "ENTER".
      Parameters:
      message - text to print before reading input.
      footer - Subtitle after the main message.
      color - text's color message, from the constants in AnsiColors enum.
      footer - text to print after reading input.

    • clearConsole

      public static void clearConsole()
